intro: Orchis morio var. tlemcenensis, commonly known as the Tlemcen orchid, is a rare variant of the common green-winged orchid. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in areas of North Africa and southern Europe. This orchid is characterized by its distinctive greenish-yellow flowers with purple markings on the dorsal sepal and petals. It typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology.
